aiowowapi.wowapi module¶

class aiowowapi.wowapi.WowApi(client_id: str, client_secret: str, client_region: Union[aiowowapi.regions.APIRegion, str], max_parallel_requests: int = 50, max_request_retries: int = 3, request_retry_delay: int = 1, request_debugging: bool = True)¶

Bases: aiowowapi.api.API

This class contains some useful functions/QoL features for working with the World of Warcraft API. For additional arguments see the API class documentation.

Parameters

  • client_id (str) – A Battle.net Project Client ID - Generated at https://develop.battle.net/access/clients

  • client_secret (str) – A Battle.net Project Client Secret - Generated at https://develop.battle.net/access/clients

  • client_region (str, APIRegion, optional) – The Battle.net/WoW API region which we submit requests to, defaults to APIRegion.US

  • max_parallel_requests (int, optional) – The maximum number of parallel aiohttp requests

  • max_request_retries (int, optional) – The maximum number of aiohttp request retries (min 1)

  • request_retry_delay (int, optional) – The delay between aiohttp request retries (min 0) (This value is in seconds)

  • request_debugging (bool, optional) – Whether exceptions should be raised requests resulting in an HTTP error (if set to false requests resulting in an HTTP error will simply return None instead of raising an exception)

async getMoney(input: int) → str¶

Converts a WoW money value to a formatted string of Gold, Silver, and Copper

Parameters

input (int) – A WoW currency/money value in copper

Returns

{}g {}s {}c

Return type

str

async getRealmSlug(input: str) → Optional[str]¶

Attempts to match user input with a WoW realm and return it’s slug

Parameters

input (str) – A string to query the realms index with (full name, id, short name, etc)

Returns

A matching realm’s slug

Return type

str

async parseArmoryLink(url: str) → Optional[str]¶

Parses a World of Warcraft Armoury link and returns the character’s name, realm, and region

Parameters

url (str) – A World of Warcraft Armoury link such as https://worldofwarcraft.com/en-us/character/us/{slug}/{character}

Returns

{‘name’: name, ‘realm’: realm_slug, ‘region’: region}

Return type

dict
